original_issue.title: Deep dive demo of the new Planner & Roadmap
original_issue.description:
There are over 900 project managers at the City of Montreal.
Currently, they are testing PP3 and PP5. Although I have explained the minor differences between the two licenses, the client is requesting a detailed presentation outlining the specific advantages and distinctions of both products. They want a clear, comprehensive comparison focused on these differences.
original_issue.impact:
At this point, I sent the following information:
Subsequently, we initiated discussions with Alithya, Microsoft's dedicated partner for Project Portfolio (PP) and Project Online (PO).
Ultimately, before moving forward, the client wants to understand the differences. Once that is clarified, they will begin discussions with the partner.

system_analysis.context_summary: This appears to be a product roadmap issue with user roadmap inquiry with medium business impact.

corrections.correction_notes: In this case Roadmap is a product.  If you evaluate the Description you will see that the words Planner and Roadmap are products from modern work.

original_issue.title: ESS Customer Interest - Johnson Controls
original_issue.description: Need to enroll Johnson Controls to the ESS Customer interest form in order to get them started in Employee Self Service Agent.  Customer is trying to deploy ESS and configure it with Service Now, and Workday. wants to displace Moveworks
original_issue.impact: High risk of increased vendor consolidation with Moveworks. currently customer HR department is using it with workday, service now, and an lms platform.

system_analysis.context_summary: This appears to be a feature enhancement issue with user configuration help with medium business impact.

corrections.correction_notes: ESS is a product called Employee Self Service.  It is where employees can change their passwords and do other maintenance items without assistance from IT.  The customer wants to use this process.  There really is no technical ask here but we would probably consider it a integration or security issue.

original_issue.title: SCOM support Linux Roadmap/confidence call with PG
original_issue.description:
The context : during the last months, customer had difficulties with integrating the latest Linux OS flavors within SCOM. There are typically two recent stories behind this : 

  

Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.5 was published Generally Available in November 2024, but wasn't supported within SCOM until a few months after – with the impact for us that we had to wait way too long before being able to offer it to our customers 
We also had a poor experience with Microsoft Support, which stated that Ubuntu 24.04 was not supported within our version of SCOM, which in fact was the case – with the impact for us that we were left with doubts on what's true or false 
The perception with the new OS integration in SCOM in our company could be summarized as follows : 

  

When a new Windows Server OS is released, the integration in SCOM of this new OS is seamless, we have literally nothing to do 
When a new Linux OS is released, the integration in SCOM is most of the time painful, it takes us hours of dealing with OpenSSL or TLS version mismatches, adjusting sudoers, deciphering cryptic error messages in the SCOM Discovery Wizard, spending time on creating Microsoft Support requests  
  

Swatch Group is considering moving Linux monitoring workflows out of SCOM.
original_issue.impact: If the solution is not provided the customer considers to move away from SCOM.

system_analysis.context_summary: This appears to be a training and documentation issue with user reporting an issue with low business impact.

step_by_step: 🔑 Step 7: Key Concept and Keyword Analysis
📈 Step 8: Business Impact and Complexity Assessment

data_sources_used.note: Used for product disambiguation and context

microsoft_products.name: roadmap
microsoft_products.title: Microsoft Roadmap - Project roadmap management
microsoft_products.description: Microsoft Roadmap provides visual representation of project timelines and milestones. It's part of the Microsoft Project suite for enterprise project management and planning. Roadmap helps teams track project progress and communicate timelines.

final_analysis.category_reason: Detected Microsoft products (['roadmap']) in training/demo context

decision_factors: ✅ Microsoft product detection + training context = Documentation request

corrections.correction_notes: Roadmap refers to WHEN SCOM will be supported by Linux. The user also wants a confidence call from someone in the PG and can confirm the roadmap (plan) of when it will be available.

original_issue.title: Checkpoint - FWaaS - AzureGW LB does not support east-west traffic inspection unlike to competitors.
original_issue.description: Azure GWLB does not support East-West traffic. therefore we are using vNet peering, in AWS they are using their GWLB with Endpoint which support it and in a direct results, the pricing gaps is huge.
original_issue.impact: Customer would like to announce a private preview with Microsoft on his SKO, delivering MVP to santander, but without doing so, the pricing will be so much higher in Azure due to using vNet Peering.

original_issue.title: [IAR] [Verohallinto] Azure Recovery Services Vault missing features
original_issue.description:
We need to understand if there plans in Recovery Services Vault PG to fix the blockers Gentax project is having when testing, designing and implementing DR strategy to their VM based application.

Background
▪ Business critical application hosted in Sweden Central Region 
▪ Azure IaaS VMs with 3 main roles: web, app and SQL DB  
▪ VM's provisioned from Market place image Windows Server 2022 
▪ VM Encryption at host with CMK 
▪ SQL server SKU FXmdsV2 series, NVMe interface, accelerated network 
▪ Premium SSD v1 OS Disk, Premium SSD v2 data disks, SQL Log on Ultra disk 
▪ RSV backup, App & Web VM all disks, SQL VM with DB data disk and DB log disks excluded 
▪ Requirement for in zone, cross zone and cross region restore for VM– Blockers / issues in VM restore fom RSV currently 
▪ Solution implemented for SQL DB backup to URL using Azure Storage Account with local and Geo DR 
▪ Requirement is to ensure and maintain consistency throughout environments

Issues
In same AZ VM restore from RSV to overwrite an existing VM
Host Encrypted and disk exclude not supported for VM restore, and does not work 
 Critical for SQL VM restore, currently leads to incompliancy for consistency target 
 In same AZ VM restore from RSV as new VM (current IaC blocker, customer issue) 
 Changes the option CreateFrom
 Blocks use of current IaC pipeline. Conflicts the consistency requirement as restored VM differ from originally provisioned VM
Cross AZ restore from RSV ZRS storage
Blocked due VM encryption not supported (host encryption) 
 RSV backup / restore with GRS 
 Not supported for Premium SSD v2 in Sweden Central. Capacity plan far in future, can it be improved? 
 VM Azure Compute Gallery Image 
 Complains about NVMe storage interface and refers to SCSi while image provisioning (May be Image properties issue) 
 Use of ASR (Azure Site Recovery) 
 Would add additional agent requirement, may lead variation between servers if not all, can not be use with SQL server 
 Preview for Premium SSD v2 
 Cost impact
original_issue.impact: The Finnish Tax Administration is migrating Gentax from on-prem to Azure. It has approximately 430 servers to migrate. And currently they are looking at the DR options in Azure. Timeframe: Customer needs this ASAP Impact: They need a way to backup their Gentax solution using a designed security baseline and features.

system_analysis.context_summary: Capacity request for SQL Database in Sweden with user requesting a feature involving servers related to sql with high business impact.
system_analysis.reasoning: The inquiry highlights multiple blockers and limitations in Azure Recovery Services Vault related to VM restore, encryption, and storage compatibility, which directly impact the customer's ability to implement their DR strategy for a critical migration project. The stated impact and urgency indicate a critical business impact. The focus on unsupported features and capacity planning aligns with the 'capacity_limits' category and 'reporting_issue' intent.

corrections.correction_notes: The user is asking for additional capabilities in Azure Recovery Services which is not a capacity issue, it is a missing feature
